title.narrative: 4.2 EDUCATION PME

description.narrative: By 2016, education managers undertake child-focused national education planning, monitoring and evaluation, and provide response to emergencies and climate change, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, increased quality and effective management of education and training systems, and increased access to pre-primary, primary and non-formal education, particularly for the most vulnerable and disadvantaged groups

Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, education managers undertake child-focused national education planning, monitoring and evaluation, and provide response toemergencies and climate change

description.narrative: In 2016, education managers were engaged in the generation of critical evidence, adopted equity-focused quality of education sector plans and budgets, established an education portal with computerized emergency reporting tools for situation monitoring and system-wide disaster management, carried out multi-sectoral actions and leveraged resources to advance education for disadvantaged children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of education managers newly trained by MOET on education planning for preparedness, response to and recovery from natural disasters and emergencies

actual.value: 2014:320 education managers were trained on assessment tools and approaches to implementation of the Provincial Action Plans for DRR and climate change in education

title.narrative: Availability and use of disaggregated data on disadvantaged children, especially out of school children for planning of targeted interventions by MOET

baseline.value: Availability and use of disaggregated data is limited (2012)

target.value: 2016:Use of disaggregated data on disadvantaged children in National report on out of school children and in 6 provincial reports on out of school children (2016)

actual.value: 2014:National report with disaggregated data on disadvantaged out of school children printed and disseminated for policy advocacy. Six brief provincial reports on equity in education were approved and printed. Dissemination of the provincial reports is in progress.

title.narrative: Extent to which natural disasters and emergencies, and climate change are integrated in MOET new school curriculum for primary education

target.value: 2015:Mitigation, preparedness and response to be integrated (2015)

actual.value: 2014:Curriculum framework developed and approved by MOET with key DRR and Climate Change content identified across levels of education. Materials are being developed for integration in subject areas and extra-curricular activities.

title.narrative: Issuance of national guidelines by MOET on education planning that integrates the rights and evidence-based approach

actual.value: 2014:National guidelines were issued for the 2015 planning process and 2016-2020, with guidance for development of an M&E framework and disseminated nation-wide to 63 provinces

title.narrative: a2a. Availability of an Education Management Information System that transparently feeds findings back to communities or school management committees - score (1-4), see guidance

actual.value: 2016:Education MIS transparently feeds findings back to communities or school management committees
